Package v

Class FormulaVisitor

java.lang.Object
v.FormulaVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Visitor
public class FormulaVisitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Visitor
This class is a formula visior class which implements the methods defined in Visitor.
Moreover, it traverses the structure of a generic LTL formula and creates a new LTL formula which represents the PNF of the formula that accepts it.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    FormulaVisitor()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Formula visit​(BinaryFormula binaryFormula)
    Visits a Binary LTL formula
    Firstly, the left and right subformulas are visited and then on the traversal back up a new Formula is generated consisting of the type of Binary formula this formula is and it's left and right subformulas
    Formula visit​(ConstantFormula constantFormula)
    Visits a constant LTL formula
    Generally, a constant is a leaf in an expression tree and this signifies the end of a particular branch of the formula.
    Formula visit​(Formula formula)
    Visits a generic LTL formula
    Formula visit​(UnaryFormula unaryFormula)
    Visits a unary LTL formula
    Firstly, it is determined whether the unary formula is of type Not and if so, distributes the Not into the subformula by applying the correct dual transformation.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • visit

      public Formula visit​(Formula formula)
      Visits a generic LTL formula
      Specified by:
      visit in interface Visitor
      Parameters:
      formula - the generic formula to visit

    • visit

      public Formula visit​(BinaryFormula binaryFormula)
      Visits a Binary LTL formula
      Firstly, the left and right subformulas are visited and then on the traversal back up a new Formula is generated consisting of the type of Binary formula this formula is and it's left and right subformulas
      Specified by:
      visit in interface Visitor
      Parameters:
      binaryFormula - the generic binary formula to visit
      Returns:
      And(L, R), Or(L, R), Until(L, R), WeakUntil(L, R) depending on the type of binary formula supplied in the parameter
      null if something goes wrong

    • visit

      public Formula visit​(UnaryFormula unaryFormula)
      Visits a unary LTL formula
      Firstly, it is determined whether the unary formula is of type Not and if so, distributes the Not into the subformula by applying the correct dual transformation. Ultimately, a new Formula object is returned.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface Visitor
      Parameters:
      unaryFormula - the generic unary formula to visit
      Returns:
      Next(C), C, or Not(C) depending on the type of unary formula supplied in the parameter and the type of dual transformation required to achieve PNF
      null if something goes wrong

    • visit

      public Formula visit​(ConstantFormula constantFormula)
      Visits a constant LTL formula
      Generally, a constant is a leaf in an expression tree and this signifies the end of a particular branch of the formula.
      Specified by:
      visit in interface Visitor
      Parameters:
      constantFormula - the generic constant formula to visit
      Returns:
      constantFormula
